definition[0]: to turn your body over once so that you are lying in a different position, or to turn someoneâ€™s body over
example[0]: Ben rolled over and kissed her.
example[1]: The guards rolled him over onto his front.
definition[1]: if you roll over a loan or investment, you obtain a new loan or investment to replace one that has MATURED (=reached the end of its life)
example[2]: Certificates of deposit are automatically rolled over at current interest rates for another period of the same duration unless the bank is given other instructions.
